intro: Mussaenda lanuginosa, commonly known as the woolly mussaenda, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and clusters of fragrant, pinkish-white flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Mussaenda lanuginosa thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
